item.title: Meghan add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "And meanwhile time goes about its immemorial work of making everyone look and feel like shit." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "Oh Christ, the exhaustion of not knowing anything. It's so tiring and hard on the nerves. It really takes it out of you, not knowing anything. You're given comedy and miss all the jokes. Every hour you get weaker. Sometimes, as I sit alone in my flat in London and stare at the window, I think how dismal it is, how heavy, to watch the rain and not know why it falls." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Stendhal
item.description: "Pleasure is often spoiled by describing it." -- Stendhal

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Emile Zola
item.description: "Blow the candle out, I don't need to see what my thoughts look like." -- Emile Zola

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I would rather sit on a pumpkin, and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Meghan add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to pee in the sink." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Poor Faulkner. Does he really think big emotions come from big words? He thinks I donâ€™t know the ten-dollar words. I know them all right. But there are older and simpler and better words, and those are the ones I use." -- Ernest Hemingway
